intro: Caragana turkestanica var. indurescens, commonly known as the Turkestan peashrub, is a deciduous shrub native to Central Asia. It features compound leaves with 10–20 pairs of oval, serrated leaflets. The plant produces small, yellow pea-like flowers in early summer, followed by elongated, woody pods containing several seeds. It is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often used for erosion control. Its hardy nature makes it a valuable plant in arid and semi-arid regions.
